business.headline: 'Shift to UAE': Kotak AMC MD Nilesh Shah flags tax loophole exploited by NRIsNilesh Shah has warned that high-net-worth individuals could exploit tax treaties with some countries to avoid India's capital gains tax.

RBI may pay record Rs 2.5 lakh crore dividend to centre in FY25The RBI is likely to announce the exact dividend amount in late May. Last year, the payout surprised many as it was double what most had expected.

Ambedkar Jayanti 2025: Is the stock market closed today?Over the past few months, benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty have seen large ups and downs, with global news, especially from the United States, playing a major role in the market's movement.

Tariff war may benefit India despite short-term shocks: Mercedes-Benz India CEOMercedes-Benz India CEO Santosh Iyer stated that India may benefit from the ongoing global tariff war in the long term despite short-term challenges. He highlights the potential for increased trade and reduced barriers as a positive outcome for India.

Why is Apple in a race against time to fly iPhones back to the US?Apple's long-term goal is to reduce its dependence on Chinese factories and shift more production to other countries, with India playing a big part in that plan.  However, it relies heavily on a network of suppliers and trained workers that only exists at the required scale in parts of Asia.

RBI launches WhatsApp Channel: Here's how to access it via QR codeThe RBI said that the goal of the WhatsApp channel is to provide verified and timely information about banking, digital safety, and other important topics directly to users.

Pentagon cuts $5.1 billion contracts with Accenture, Deloitte: Wasteful spendingThe contracts appeared to be wide-ranging cuts to consulting services for the Navy, the Air Force, the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) and the Defense Health Agency.

Wall Street bounces back after wild week fueled by tariff warAll three major US indexes ended the session sharply higher after assurances from Boston Federal Reserve President Susan Collins that the Fed is prepared to keep financial markets functioning should the need arise.

India pushing for trade deals with US, EU with high urgency: JaishankarOn Wednesday, Trump announced a 90-day pause on his sweeping tariffs on all countries, except China as countries around the world wilted under the impact of the seismic action.

How Trump tariffs could make iPhones, cars, and clothes costlier in the USTrump's latest plan includes a massive 145% tax on goods coming from China. Experts say this could end the long run of cheap, imported goods that Americans have enjoyed for decades.
Sensex ends 1,300 points higher, Nifty above 22,500; Tata Steel up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,310.11 points to close at 75,157.26, while the NSE Nifty50 added 429.40 points to end at 22,828.55.

Mutual fund SIP vs PPF: What Rs 1 lakh a year can earn in 15 yearsPPF is a government scheme with a current interest rate of around 7.1% per annum. On the other hand, SIPs typically offer higher interest when invested over the long term, especially in equity mutual funds. But they carry some risk, as returns depend on the market.

entertainment.headline: More of Hrithik, Saba, and little Malti in Priyanka's April photo-dump 'so far'Actor Priyanka Chopra on Monday gave a glimpse into her 'April so far'. She shared a new photo from her outing with Krrish co-star Hrithik Roshan and his partner, Saba Azad.

End hate: Apoorva Mukhija stands by friend Rida Tharana over black magic commentApoorva Mukhija has spoken out following criticism directed at Rida Tharana over her remarks on black magic. She calls for an end to spreading negativity.

Sunita Ahuja's 'zip it' reaction to paparazzi asking about Govinda. WatchGovinda and his wife, Sunita Ahuja, faced divorce rumours earlier this year. Now, her reaction to paps asking about her husband's absence from an event has gone viral in a new video.

Samantha says same role, same days, but paid 'dramatically different' than menActor Samantha opened up about the significant pay gap between her and her male counterparts in the Telugu film industry. She advocated for equal pay for equal work.

Jaat box office Day 4: Sunny Deol's film misses Rs 50 crore mark in 1st weekend Sunny Deol's 'Jaat' collected around Rs 40 crore nett in India after its extended opening weekend. The film showed impressive growth on its first Sunday, which is a good sign for its future run domestically.

Pawan Kalyan's wife Anna offers hair at Tirumala after son survives fire accidentActor-politician Pawan Kalyan's wife Anna Lezhneva tonsured her head after their son, Mark Shankar, survived the fire accident at his school in Singapore. Anna vowed her hair to Lord Venkateshwara at the Tirumala Tirupati temple.

Good Bad Ugly box office Day 4: Ajith's film to top Dragon soon, nears Rs 100 croreAjith's 'Good Bad Ugly' is moving at a decent pace. While it is yet to surpass the benchmark of Rs 100 crore domestically, the film has already managed to cross that mark worldwide.

The Last of Us 2 Episode 1 review: Pedro Pascal show hits the sweet spotReleased-Mon Apr 14, 2025The pilot episode of HBO's highly-anticipated The Last of Us Season 2 is here, and it is safe to say that the audiences are in for an exhilarating ride. Once again. Read our complete take on the first episode here.

Babil Khan reacts to trolling over old apology video: Some memes hurt meActor Babil Khan broke his silence on the trolling that he was subjected to after hi repeated apologies for mistakenly photobombing a woman at an event.
I do feel bad: Taarak Mehta creator Asit Modi breaks silence on controversies'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' creator Asit Modi responded to allegations raised by former actors of the show.

Kylie Jenner, Timothee Chalamet kiss and cuddle at Coachella 2025. WatchKylie Jenner and Timothee Chalamet were clicked together on the second day of Coachella on April 12. The two indulged in PDA at the event.

Mother-to-be Gauahar Khan dazzles on ramp, flaunts baby bump. WatchGauhara Khan, who is expecting her second child with husband Zaid Darbar, stole the attention with her stunning ramp walk. The actor flaunted her baby bump in a viral video.

Why Adolescence actor Owen Cooper hasn't watched his hit Netflix showActor Owen Cooper recently reacted to the screening of the Netflix series Adolescence in schools. The actor called it his 'worst nightmare'

Actor Mouni Roy breaks silence on plastic surgery rumours and brutal trollingActor Mouni Roy has been trolled after reports of her getting plastic surgery surfaced. She broke her silence on the relentless trolling at a recent event.

Hrithik Roshan's US event organisers reject mismanagement claims after complaintsHrithik Roshan's fans were upset after they were denied photos and autographs at the actor's US event. However, the organisers have now reacted to the claims going viral.

Jaat box office Day 3: Sunny Deol's film rakes in Rs 25 crore in IndiaSunny Deol's recently released film 'Jaat' earned over Rs 25 crore in India in three days. The film has been receiving mixed reviews from all quarters.
Salman Khan's adorable gesture for young fan wins the internet. WatchSalman Khan's adorable gesture for a young fan has gone viral. In the clip, the actor obliged the little one with a picture.

Sunny Deol's weighs in on Salman Khan's statement about actors' insecuritySunny Deol, while promoting his film 'Jaat' in the national capital, discussed the issue of actor insecurity, a topic recently highlighted by Salman Khan. Deol expressed that insecurity is a natural part of an actor's growth journey and can serve as a stepping stone rather than a hindrance.

First watch movie, then...: Phule actor's appeal as row delays releasePratik Gandhi's upcoming film, 'Phule', has been postponed. In an interview, the actor urged the Brahmin community not to form opinions about the film based solely on the trailer.

general news.headline: PM Modi won't spare looters of poor: Union minister on Mehul Choksi's arrestMoments after fugitive diamond trader Mehul Choksi was arrested in Belgium in connection with the PNB loan fraud case, the Centre celebrated the development, with junior Finance Minister Pankaj Chaudhary reiterating Prime Minister Narendra Modi's promise to recover money from those who looted the poor and return it to them.

Will blow up his car: Actor Salman Khan gets another death threat, case filedThe fresh threat to Salman Khan comes almost exactly a year after multiple rounds were fired outside his Bandra home. Over the last few years, the Bollywood actor has received multiple threats from the Lawrence Bishnoi gang.

Trump's 'nobody gets off the hook' warning triggers fresh tariff fearsDonald Trump said that his administration is preparing a national security investigation focused specifically on semiconductors and the entire electronics supply chain, much of which depends heavily on Chinese manufacturing.

Girl, 5, murdered after attempted rape in Karnataka, accused killed in encounterThe Karnataka Police killed a Patna man accused of attempting to rape a minor girl in an encounter. The accused, Ritesh, tried to flee after attacking officers, prompting police to open fire. He later succumbed to his injuries in the hospital.
Katy Perry to fly into space aboard first all-women flight of 21st century todayThe launch is scheduled to take place at Blue Origin's West Texas site, with the window opening at 7:00 pm ISR.

Mehul Choksi arrested in Belgium on India's request for extradition: SourcesThe arrest, made at the request of Indian agencies including the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and the Enforcement Directorate (ED), follows non-bailable warrants issued against him by Mumbai courts.

34 killed, 117 injured after Russian missiles hit Ukraine amid peace talksTwo Russian ballistic missiles hit Ukraine's Sumy on Sunday, killing 34 and injuring 117. This was the deadliest strike for the country this year, Ukrainian officials said.

Elon and I are great: Trump aide Navarro brushes off Musk insults over tariffsThe spat erupted earlier this month when Musk criticized Navarro's stance on trade, calling him a "moron" and "dumber than a sack of bricks" after Navarro dismissed Musk's call for zero tariffs between the US and Europe.

Pawan Kalyan's wife Anna offers hair at Tirumala after son survives fire accidentActor-politician Pawan Kalyan's wife Anna Lezhneva tonsured her head after their son, Mark Shankar, survived the fire accident at his school in Singapore. Anna vowed her hair to Lord Venkateshwara at the Tirumala Tirupati temple.

Cyber attack on IAF aircraft involved in Myanmar quake relief op: Defence sourcesA GPS-spoofing attack targetted an Indian Air Force's C-130J aircraft while it was flying over Myanmar during the Operation Brahma relief mission in the earthquake-hit Southeast Asian country, defence sources told India Today TV.

Tense calm in Murshidabad after anti-Waqf clashes; Trinamool, BJP play blame gameOn Sunday, some miscreants tried to carry out attacks in a few places, according to the border forces. But, they were soon overpowered by the BSF. While the situation remained under control, political parties continued to trade barbs over who was responsible for the unrest.
Gonna sing in space: Katy Perry shows her call sign, capsule, seat for spaceflightThe American pop singer shared a video on her Instagram giving a tour of her spaceship capsule.

Nitish for CM again? Why BJP isn't telling Bihar yetThe BJP leadership faces a pivotal decision: unequivocally endorse Nitish and signal stability or promote an alternative, thus asserting its new primacy in Bihar politics?

Girl gangraped in front of fiance in UP's Kasganj, 8 arrestedThe incident took place around 2:30 pm on April 10, when the couple was sitting by a canal along the roadside. Seeing them alone, a group of miscreants approached and allegedly held the man hostage while gangraping his fiance, police said.

Karun Nair's 89 in vain as Mumbai end Delhi's dream runDC vs MI, IPL 2025: Karun Nair scored 89 runs off 40 balls, but his knock went in vain as the Delhi Capitals lost to the Mumbai Indians by 12 runs on Sunday at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi.

India flying and how: Air passenger traffic set for  80% jump in 5 yearsThe magnitude of the projected expansion indicates how infrastructure for airports, runways and corridors linking big and small cities will need to keep pace

Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Porter agent calls customer lazy for tower-to-tower delivery, video sparks debateThe Porter delivery man, who documented the process in the video, turned the camera toward tower 17, from where he had to collect the order, and then pointed at tower 19 in the same apartment complex, where it needed to be delivered.

Who is Nikita Casap? US teen charged with parents' murder, plotting to kill TrumpAuthorities said that Nikita Casap, 17, killed his parents in February in a plan to finance the assassination of US President Donald Trump and overthrow his government.

Watch: Virat Kohli gets pranked by RCB teammates after win vs RRRoyal Challengers Bengaluru players pulled off a hilarious prank on Virat Kohli after their win against  Rajasthan Royals. Tim David stole Virat's bat, which saw hilarious reactions from the legendary batter.

Trump declared 'fully fit' to lead US, drops 20 pounds since last termTrump's physician, Navy Capt. Sean Barbabella, cited an "active lifestyle" that "continues to contribute significantly" to the Republican president's well-being. Trump turns 79 on June 14.

Congress has 'twisted' history, says Delhi Minister on Jallianwala anniversaryMarking 106 years since the Jallianwala Bagh massacre, political tensions resurfaced as BJP leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa criticised Congress for erasing national heroes' legacies while honouring invaders, calling for historical reflection and recognition.

Video: DU college principal coats classroom with cow dung for 'research'The principal of Delhi University's Laxmibai College shared the video herself with the college's teachers' group, noting that indigenous methods are being adopted to cool classrooms in C Block.

sports.headline: Watch: Virat Kohli gets pranked by RCB teammates after win vs RRRoyal Challengers Bengaluru players pulled off a hilarious prank on Virat Kohli after their win against  Rajasthan Royals. Tim David stole Virat's bat, which saw hilarious reactions from the legendary batter.

About time RCB started winning at home: Padikkal jokes after 4th away winRoyal Challengers Bengaluru beat Rajasthan Royals 9 wickets in Jaipur on Sunday. This was RCB's 4th away win in the IPL in as many games. After the match, batter Devdutt Padikkal joked that it was about time RCB started to win at home.

RCB not worried about their poor home form in IPL 2025: Mo BobatRoyal Challengers Bengaluru's director of cricket, Mo Bobat, said that he was not worried about the team's home vs away record in the IPL 2025. This season, RCB have done well while visiting other venues, but have floundered at home.

I had the confidence: Karun Nair after making sizzling IPL comebackKarun Nair put in an incredible show with the bat in his comeback to the Indian Premier League. Nair was the lone warrior for Delhi Capitals but was not able to take them home. Speaking after the match, Karun Nair said that he had the confidence that he would do well if given a chance this season.

Karn Sharma relishes MI return after match-winning performance vs DCIPL 2025: Mumbai Indians spinner Karna Sharma said that he was relishing his return to the Mumbai Indians. Sharma returned to the MI side and picked up 3 wickets in his very first match of the tournament vs Delhi Capitals.

Karn trumps Karun: Spinner points out game-changing moment in DC vs MIMumbai Indians' Karn Sharma ruined Karun Nair's IPL comeback on Sunday, April 13. Karn picked up 3 wickets in a nervy game which handed Mumbai their second win of the season.

Karun Nair logs back into IPL, seamlessly syncs with new-age T20 gameIPL 2025, DC vs MI: After waiting for three long years, Karun Nair grabbed the opportunity with both hands after scoring 89 runs off 40 balls for the Delhi Capitals against Mumbai Indians in Sunday's clash at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.

Didn't see retiring out decision negatively, it was done for the team: Tilak VarmaMumbai Indians' (MI) batter Tilak Varma opened up about his team's decision to retire him out vs Lucknow Super Giants and said that he never took it negatively and understood that it was done for the team's cause.

Ambati Rayudu backs Karun Nair to make Test comeback in EnglandFormer India cricketer-turned commentator Ambati Rayudu has backed Karun Nair to make a comeback to the Indian Test team following his prolific run in the domestic season. Nair scored 89 (40) against Mumbai Indians (MI) on his IPL comeback after three years.

Karun Nair took us by surprise: Hardik admits DC batter put pressure on MIIPL 2025, DC vs MI: Hardik Pandya said that Karun Nair made life difficult for the Mumbai Indians bowlers in Sunday's clash at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. Nair made 89 off 40 before Mitchell Santner dismissed him.

Watch: Axar Patel's hilarious take on DC's 12-run loss vs MI: 'Mumbai ke pass'Delhi Capitals' (DC) captain Axar Patel gave a hilarious answer to Murali Kartik's question following his team's 12-run loss against Mumbai Indians (MI) at Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi.

Nair scored 89 (40) against Mumbai Indians (MI) on his IPL comeback after three years.

Watch: Axar Patel's hilarious take on DC's 12-run loss vs MI: 'Mumbai ke pass'Delhi Capitals' (DC) captain Axar Patel gave a hilarious answer to Murali Kartik's question following his team's 12-run loss against Mumbai Indians (MI) at Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
